posts.name: Yash Aggarwal
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.41.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

For more information about this feature, you can read our blog post about it..

Note: in order to test this feature, your primary device should be on the latest beta.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.40.0-beta.1…v7.41.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Signal >> Blog >> A Synchronized Start for Linked Devices

50 new commits since 7.40.0-beta.2:

  • v7.41.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Advertise both link and sync capabilities [36]

  • removeFromGroup: Don't use removed member for credentials [37]

  • Disallow conversation model creation during import [38]

  • Update to latest backup integration tests [39]

  • Enable link & sync in beta [45]

  • Fix accidental loop during backup import [46]

  • Wrap link preview description for long words (#9683) [47]

  • release notes for 7.41 [48]

  • Update strings [49]

  • 7.41.0-beta.1 [50]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Welcome Yash and congrats on your first post!! Excited to see what’s coming!

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked:
If you’d like to help test this feature without affecting your existing beta instance, these test desktop builds will install alongside your beta installation.

Note: these builds are only for testing, and will expire in 30 days.

  • Windows
  • Mac
  • Linux

posts.name: KIllerKingSolo
posts.cooked: I have beta on both IOS and Windows yet the 45-day message doesnt pop up even if i unlink and relink

posts.name: Trevor Biller
posts.cooked:
We only support syncing to a clean Desktop install; if you relink to an instance with existing messages & media, you won’t see the prompt to sync. Could that be the case here?

To sync, you would need to fully delete all data first, via the Settings → Privacy screen.

Note that doing so would delete all media, and older media won’t be restored by the sync process. That’s why we’ve limited it to clean installs for now.

posts.name: Bme13
posts.cooked:
Just linked the Desktop with an Android phone. Worked great and while not a real issue I have quite a few chats that only show the number on the desktop while on Android a name is shown. This also happened the previous test.
These are all empty chats except for the ‘X has joined signal’ message and those people currently don’t have Signal installed anymore (as shown in the chat: ‘This person isn’t using Signal’).

Desktop log

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.41.0-beta.1/01d8db505a9bf57b056230b40f65825a7cb88e618f5a0c8286ba40ac4a3e0a88.gz

Android log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.0/b7d12b080181ba6fdbbaeffb7be98c1fbf44e822315c9e46bd692329f624651e

Chats got unmuted as soon as I booted into Windows and Signal Desktop opened up, I mute them again but a few seconds later they get unmuted again.

Desktop log:
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.41.0-beta.1/7a1c9a611f100f1cdbd33cd62c9ec44386564c1768bdf567da96fb5deb4149ac.gz

Android log:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.2/a70db92e4ed3c3b1a290ebf832663a44ebf73fce56db643c8ad2ca3da99aa3e2

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.45 release

posts.cooked:
All my chats got unmuted. But I am on Android 7.30.2 (non beta). And desktop is also non beta.

Desktop might be the problem?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
On Desktop for a group chat all messages from other users for up to a month have dissapeared for me and all my messages show up as sent only and not delivered.

For other groups all group history has been trimmed to a specific date. No such issues on my Android and iOS clients.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.41.0-beta.1/66a4e61cbd5f7478e86d68ec9dd0dd01ff641fb664ca5f6a402b5630870c586a.gz

It is always possible to click leave on a group that has admin only messages by pressing on the three dots in the top right hand corner then pressing Leave Chat, which can be confusing if you’ve blocked a group before and reported it. The message that you are no longer part of the group should probably be shown somewhere.

@Whatnoww Oh no sorry about the missing messages! I’ll follow up in PM to ask for more info.

Regarding the reports of unmuted chats, we are really sorry for the inconvenience! A hotfix release went to production and we plan to release a new beta to fix it as well.
Is it fixed in 7.40.1?

Yes, 7.40.1 has the fix. We also just released beta 7.41.0-beta.2 with the fix. The chats affected will need to be muted again but it should be fixed going forward. So sorry about it and thank you for reporting the bug early.

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked: In the ‘optimizing application’ window, the text is dark on a dark background… in dark mode. Maybe it would also be a good idea to use a white logo in dark mode there.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Just noticed it’s not intuitive at all on Desktop to edit a group description. The edit button just does not show up if you hover over the group description. You need to hover over the group name for it to show up, and it’s not obvious that’ll let you modify the group description. If I spent 30 seconds looking for how to edit it, imagine a new user.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: This is in production now. I received the update yesterday

posts.name: skmedix
posts.cooked: I think this thread can be closed? There is already a beta 7.42 :)
